page.title: 01VILLAGES
page.content: {Villages of Grimoldby, South {Cockerington and part of Manby and {Stewton, Lincolnshire This area is cultivated marshland between the Lincolnshire Wolds and the North Sea. The Wolds are 4 miles to the West and the sea coast is 6 miles to the East. Height of land above sea level varies between 20 feet and 65 feet. The soil is heavy clay and has to be drained artificially into dykes and thence to small rivers which drain into the sea. Although there are local workers many residents work in the nearest market town of Louth 6 miles to the North West. Others commute to Grimsby or Lincoln and a few fly to North Sea gas rigs. The number of pensioners retiring to this area is increasing and most houses are owner occupied.
